oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Newbern Illinois Central Depot: front view
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Junction of Main and Jefferson Streets, Newbern, Dyer County, TN

Black and white photograph of a one-story brick depot with one bay with three rectangular windows; open door to the right of the bay windows; bent ladder in front of bay; sign on bay reads "Newbern"; two windows and a second door to the left of the bay

The Illinois Central Depot was built in 1920 for the Illinois Central Railroad to replace the wood frame building that burned in 1918. The depot is exemplary of a "combination depot" in that it contains the passenger shelter, freight house, and business office under one roof. As of 1995, the building had recently undergone restoration to restore it to its 1920 condition using the original architectural drawings as a guide.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Historic buildings -- Tennessee; Railroad stations -- Tennessee
Renovation
